hanzi-su-wiki:
親

Значения

Родители; дружеский, близкий; сближаться, подружиться

Мнемоника

  • Преступнику, которого пороли розгами 亲, разрешалось видеться 見 лишь с родными.

  • Родитель стоит 立 на вершине дерева 木, чтобы посмотреть 見 на своего ребёнка.

Варианты

亲

qīn
parent; one's own (flesh and blood); relative; related; marriage; bride; close; intimate; in person; first-hand; in favor of; pro-; to kiss; (Internet slang) dear

qìng
parents-in-law of one's offspring
свекровь ребенка

(Simplified: 亲)
Pictophonetic: 亲 indicates the sound; 見 (see) conveys the meaning.
Antonyms: 疏
purpleculture_examples:
親自 [ qīn zì ]: personally; in person; oneself
親切 [ qīn qiè ]: amiable; cordial; close and dear; familiar
親戚 [ qīn qi ]: a relative (i.e. family relation); Classifiers: 门
親家 [ qìng jia ]: parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law; relatives by marriage

• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亲 [ qīn ] relatives, parents; intimate; the hazelnut tree
    • 見 [ jiàn ] to see, to observe, to meet, to appear
heisig_chinese_memo: Relatives standing on top of a tree watching what their kids are doing.
heisig_constituent: parent, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, see, telescope, eye, human legs
koohiiStory1: A wise parent lets their kids learn. A kid wants to try to eat the red pepper plant, the wise parent says "Try it and see for yourself".
koohiiStory2: I remember this one the way the Japanese do: a parent standing on top of a tree watching what his or her kid is doing.
kunYomi: おや、おや-、した.しい、した.しむ
jp_example_words:
親しむ(したしむ): to be intimate with, to befriend
親善(しんぜん): friendship
肉親(にくしん): blood relationship, blood relative
親(おや): parents
親指(おやゆび): thumb
親しい(したしい): intimate, close
親友(しんゆう): close friend
親戚(しんせき): relative
親類(しんるい): relation, kin
父親(ちちおや): father
母親(ははおや): mother
親切(しんせつ): kind
両親(りょうしん): parents, both parents
jp_readingExamples: 親 (おや), 親しい (した.しい), 親しむ (した.しむ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you see a tree that you want to stand under to take a break while hiking, a good parent will stand under the tree with you. This is a kind and caring parent who can see that you are tired and want to relax by standing in the shade of this tree.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine that you’re on a long mountain hike and so far you’ve been hiking all in the sun with no shade. Feel the sun beating down on your back, the sweat getting in your eyes. Finally you see a tree to seek refuge under. It’s like an oasis in a desert. You’re saved!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once you get closer to the tree, you and your parent see that it has some pretty crazy roots coming out of it. While making your way into the shade, you manage to bang your shin (しん) on one of these roots. Your shins already hurt from walking so much, and this is just icing on the cake.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Busting your shins on things really hurts. I'm sure you've hit your shins on coffee tables and the like all your life. Remember that pain and think how much worse it would be banging your bare shins on pointy tree roots after you've been hiking all day in the hot sun. Not enjoyable.
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 并, 十 (десять), 木 (дерево), 立 (стоять), 見 (видеть), 辛 (острый на вкус)
Ru_trainchinese:
qīn: (сущ/прил/нареч/глаг) родитель; кровный; близкий, интимный; лично, сам; целовать; пользоваться расположением, получать поддержку
qìng: (графема) родственники, возникшие в результате заключения брака
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you stand in the tree (亲) looking (見) for your parents
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The small chili peppers are relatives of the larger ones which came before them.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jin Wen said personally, Ke Zhong: "The royal family ordered (destined) to overcome the Jingdong to Yujing 𠂤 (teacher)." It is also pronounced " lining ", which means clothes, Wang Chengui: "Yi (Gi) female (ru) Zhu Huang (heng), 𠦪 (贲) kiss (lining)." "Ben lining" means gorgeous clothes, "Jade Pian": "lining, close-fitting clothes." "Said Wen": "Dear, to also. From See you."

The ancient text " depends " and " see " the difference is that " depends on " the human form is standing, " see " the human form is kneeling. " Xin " is a sound symbol. The " Xin " of the Qin Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period is derived from " Wood ", which is the original of Xiaozhuan.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " sin " to " see " in ancient text, the original meaning is personal.
humanum_full_description:
金文表示親自，克鐘：「王親令(命)克遹涇東至于京𠂤(師)。」又讀作「襯」，表示衣服，王臣簋：「易(賜)女(汝)朱黃(衡)、𠦪(賁)親(襯)。」「賁襯」表示華美的衣服，《玉篇》：「襯，近身衣。」《說文》：「親，至也。从見，亲聲。」

　　古文字「視」與「見」的分別在於「視」的人形是站立的，「見」的人形是跪坐的。「辛」是聲符。戰國秦簡「辛」下從「木」，為小篆所本。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「辛」從「視」的古文，本義是親自。

  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 亲 [ qīn ] relatives, parents; intimate; the hazelnut tree

①有血統或夫妻關係的：親屬。親人。親緣。雙親(父母)。親眷。
②婚姻：親事。
③因婚姻聯成的關係：親戚。親故。親鄰。親朋。
④稱呼同一地方的人：鄉親。
⑤本身，自己的：親睹。親聆。親筆。
⑥感情好，關係密切：親密。相親。親睦。親疏。
⑦用嘴脣接觸表示喜愛：親吻。
⑧疏。

金文表示親自，克鐘：「王親令(命)克遹涇東至于京𠂤(師)。」又讀作「 襯 」，表示衣服，王臣簋：「易(賜)女(汝)朱黃(衡)、𠦪(賁)親(襯)。」「賁襯」表示華美的衣服，《玉篇》：「襯，近身衣。」《說文》：「親，至也。从見，亲聲。」 古文字「 視 」與「 見 」的分別在於「 視 」的人形是站立的，「 見 」的人形是跪坐的。「 辛 」是聲符。戰國秦簡「 辛 」下從「 木 」，為小篆所本。
Jin Wen said personally, Ke Zhong: "The royal family ordered (destined) to overcome the Jingdong to Yujing 𠂤 (teacher)." It is also pronounced " lining", which means clothes, Wang Chengui: "Yi (Gi) female (ru) Zhu Huang (heng), 𠦪 (贲) kiss (lining)." "Ben lining" means gorgeous clothes, "Jade Pian": "lining, close-fitting clothes." "Said Wen": "Dear, to also. From See you." The ancient text " depends" and " see" the difference is that " depends on" the human form is standing, " see" the human form is kneeling. " Xin" is a sound symbol. The " Xin" of the Qin Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period is derived from " Wood", which is the original of Xiaozhuan.

親字的基本解释

親
qīn

親
qìng
均见“亲”。

親字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qīn］
［《廣韻》七人切，平真，清。］
亦作“媇1”。亦作“寴1”。“亲1”的繁体字。
(1)爱；亲爱。
(2)指亲爱的心。
(3)和睦。
(4)亲近；亲密。
(5)指亲近的人。
(6)接近；接触。
(7)信任，相信。
(8)结交。
(9)亲自，躬亲。
(10)父母。亦偏指父或母。
(11)亲人，亲戚。
(12)亲生；嫡亲。
(13)引申为嫡传。
(14)结亲；婚配。
(15)指新妇。
(16)特指用嘴唇接触人或东西，表示喜爱、亲热。
(17)准，真切。
(18)通“新”。
(19)姓。战国齐有亲弗。见《史记·孟尝君列传》。
[②]［qìng］
［《廣韻》七遴切，去震，清。］
亦作“媇2”。“亲2”的繁体字。
见“親2家”。

親字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【見字部】　親； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1136第12
〔古文〕?寴?【唐韻】【正韻】七人切【集韻】【韻會】雌人切，?七平聲。【廣韻】愛也。【孝經序】親譽日著。【註】慈愛之心曰親。【荀子·不苟篇】交親而不比。【註】親謂仁恩。【周語】慈惠保民，親也。　又近也。【易·乾卦】本乎天者親上，本乎地者親下。　又【增韻】躬也。【詩·小雅】弗躬弗親。【箋】言不躬而親之也。【禮·文王世子】世子親齊?而養。【註】親，猶自也。　又【釋名】襯也。言相隱襯也。【增韻】姻也。【禮·大傳】親者，屬也。【疏】謂有親者，各以屬而爲之服。【左傳·昭十四年】祿勳合親。【杜註】親，九族也。【周禮·地官·大司徒】以隂禮敎親，則民不怨。【註】謂男女之禮，婚姻以時，則男不曠，女不怨。　又六親，父母、兄弟、妻子也。【管子·牧民篇】上服度則六親固。又【前漢·禮樂志註】如淳曰：父、子、從父昆弟、從祖昆弟、曾祖昆弟、族昆弟，爲六親。　又姓。【史記·孟嘗君傳】齊王逐周最，而聽親弗。【註】親弗，人姓名。【戰國策】作祝弗。　又通作新。【大學】在親民。【程註

Dear
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qīn］
["Guangyun" seven people cut, plain and clear. ]
Also known as "媇1". Also known as "寴1". Traditional characters for "亲1".
(1) Love; dear.
(2) Refers to dear heart.
(3) Harmony.
(4) Close; close.
(5) Refers to a close person.
(6) Approach; contact.
(7) Trust, believe.
(8) Make friends.
(9) Personally and personally.
(10) Parents. It also refers to the father or mother.
(11) Relatives, relatives.
(12) One's own; a direct relative.
(13) The extension is a direct biography.
(14) Getting married; marriage.
(15) Refers to the bride.
(16) Especially referring to touching people or things with the lips to express affection and affection.
(17) Accurate and true.
(18) Through "new".
(19) Last name. The Warring States period has pro-Fu. See "Historical Biography of Meng Changjun".
[②]［qìng］
["Guangyun" Seven Lining, Quzhen, Qing. ]
Also known as "媇2". The traditional characters of "亲2".
See "Dear 2".
Dear
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [See the Department of Words] 　 kiss; Kangxi strokes: 16; page number: page 1136 to 12
[Ancient text]? 寴? [Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Seven people cut [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Female cut,? Seven flat sound. [Guang Yun] Love also. [Preface to the Scriptures of Filial Piety] Familiar with each other. [Note] A loving heart is called kiss. 【Xunzi·Meticulous Article】Compared with relatives. [Note] It is called benevolence and kindness. [Zhou Yu] Be kind and protect the people, and be close to you.　It's near again. [Easy·Qian Gua] Those who are from the heavens kiss, and those who are from the earth kiss.　[Zeng Yun] Bow also. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Follow yourself. 【Jing】Knowing without words. 【Li·Wen Wang Shizi】The ancestors are raised together. [Note] My dear, it's still self.　 [Release Name] Lin Ye. The words are faintly contrasted. [Zeng Yun] Marriage also. [Li·Biography] Relatives, family members. 【Sparse】It means that those who have relatives shall serve each other according to the genus. [Zuo Zhuan·14th year of Zhao] Lu Xun married. [Du Note] Dear, the nine nationalities also. 【Zhou Li·Di Guan·Da Situ】If you kiss your relatives with Yin etiquette, the people will not complain. [Note] It refers to the rituals of men and women. When the marriage is time, the man will not be open and the woman will not complain.　There are six relatives, parents, brothers, and wives. [Guanzi·Herder Chapter] The upper service degree is six relatives. Also [Previous Han·Liyuezhi Note] Ru Chun said: Father, Son, Congfu Kundi, Congzu Kundi, Great-grandfather Kundi, and Clan Kundi are six relatives.　Another last name. 【Historical Records·Meng Changjun Biography】The King of Qi traveled the most from week to week, and listened to profuse. [Note] Qin Fu, the person's name. [Warring States Policy] As Zhu Fu.　It's new again. [University] is close to the people. 【Cheng Note

Dear
Name meaning
Nothing.
qīn, qìng
вм. 亲

親

Значения

Родители; дружеский, близкий; сближаться, подружиться

Мнемоника

  • Преступнику, которого пороли розгами 亲, разрешалось видеться 見 лишь с родными.

  • Родитель стоит 立 на вершине дерева 木, чтобы посмотреть 見 на своего ребёнка.

Варианты

亲

Radicals: 立, 木, 見  (stand, tree, see)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you see a tree that you want to stand under to take a break while hiking, a good parent will stand under the tree with you. This is a kind and caring parent who can see that you are tired and want to relax by standing in the shade of this tree.
Imagine that you’re on a long mountain hike and so far you’ve been hiking all in the sun with no shade. Feel the sun beating down on your back, the sweat getting in your eyes. Finally you see a tree to seek refuge under. It’s like an oasis in a desert. You’re saved!
Reading Mnemonic
Once you get closer to the tree, you and your parent see that it has some pretty crazy roots coming out of it. While making your way into the shade, you manage to bang your shin (しん) on one of these roots. Your shins already hurt from walking so much, and this is just icing on the cake.
Busting your shins on things really hurts. I'm sure you've hit your shins on coffee tables and the like all your life. Remember that pain and think how much worse it would be banging your bare shins on pointy tree roots after you've been hiking all day in the hot sun. Not enjoyable.
